reviews.review_msg: She's such a nice person but she is so disorganized and most of the time it felt like her grading criteria was just her closing her eyes and throwing darts at a board. Such a tough marker in assignments and the unclear grading criteria made it even harder. I hope she changes how she grades things because her lectures are good and she is delightful

I honestly don't know why Dr. Hippmann gets so much hate. She was very nice, kind, and provided many resources to do well in her course. Exams were structured for students to perform not so great but the lower exam marks were compensated with easier quizzes and class engagement activities. Took this course as an intersession course.
She was so unorganized, her classes were a waste of time and when asked about how homework was marked, she could not give an explanation why we were given the grades we were

I'm taking ENVS 100 as my first environmental science course, and I don't understand why we're given assignments like Excel or drawing tasks in an online class. These assignments often feel unrelated and don't connect to the quizzes or exams at all. Some problems are based on content that wasn't even covered in class. I wouldn't recommend.

Took evsc 201w with her last term. Anna is fine, the main problem was the TA Cassandra Pereira. I think being a TA and has gotten to her head to where she is power tripping. I handed in the the final assignment literature review and it felt like she didn't even read it based on her comments. When I asked for better help her had a sour attitude.

Don't know why she gets so much hate for EVSC 100. It was a blended course (online videos for lectures and in-person tutorials and exams). Exams were reasonably fair with maybe a few questions not coming from the online lectures (On top of videos there are readings and yt videos for lectures). Overall weekly workload is about 2hrs/week.
Got on probation just because of her, asked her for help, starts to blame me please avoid her worst of sfus profs

Tons of assignments, professor is late on uploading material, the class is very time consuming and the exams are not like the modules at ALL. The professor states that she wouldn't put anything on the exam that wasn't in the modules, and that was just a lie. Avoid this class unless you REALLY care about the environment, also tons of extra readings.
This course is very poorly presented and expect alot of work. Take it only if you want to major in environmental sciences otherwise it's gonna be a very bad decision
blames students if they do bad, exams are very hard please avoide her..

Disorganized, releases material late, has very unclear instructions ... is NOT first language.Difficult to understand her use of words. YOU WILL use excel (OL). OL material is ALL reused, her lecture videos she will often say that it is the year 2022 because thats when the recording is from. 
-don't recommend
-not a easy credit, take CA135 for that

Quizzes are easy but time consuming. Exam questions are incredibly ambiguous. The modules' learning goals do not resemble the exams themes/questions at all. Best to just avoid this class, it's not a gpa booster.

Participation required no class time to work on assignments/discuss project with ur group. Shes disorganized, inconsiderate, doesnt convey the purpose of the class thru in-class activities. This was a 3 hour long lecture in the evening and she gave us a break almost never. Shes a good person but a genuinely terrible prof. Awful experience.

incredibly easy course delivered by an amazing prof. Marks only came from tutorials worksheets, class participation, and exams, all of which are easy. Just do the tutorials and participation. Take notes and review thsoe and slides for exams. shes very passionate about the course.
